snippet: The airstrikes were aimed at stopping militants from seizing the Haditha Dam and preventing the possibility of floodwaters flowing toward Baghdad.
abstract: Strikes on Sunni militant positions near Haditha Dam in Iraq, in effort to prevent release of floodwaters toward Baghdad, deepen American military engagement in Iraq.

byline.original: By HELENE COOPER, KAREEM FAHIM and C. J. CHIVERS
byline.contributor: Helene Cooper reported from Tbilisi, Kareem Fahim from Baghdad, and C. J. Chivers from the United States. Ali Hamza and Omar al-Jawoshy contributed reporting from Baghdad, and an employee of The New York Times from Anbar Province, Iraq.

lead_paragraph: The airstrikes were aimed at stopping militants from seizing the Haditha Dam and preventing the possibility of floodwaters flowing toward Baghdad.

headline.main: U.S. Launches New Airstrikes on ISIS to Protect Dam in Iraq
headline.print_headline: U.S. Intervention in Iraq Extends to a Second Dam

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
